Articles.Content: Just wanted to drop a thank you, this shows alot of potential. I love the idea with the time shift. Great GREAT stuff.
One question though - what happens if you go on a suborbital lasting say 10 minutes and sync 20 minutes into the future, what happens?

To Queril:

Wel, i can't connect anymore KMP GUI disappears and stuck on syncing

I'm sorry to hear that.

Though server's capped atp, 8/8, might be that.

also, if it's not too hard, when server software updates, pls notify me (anyone)

Edited October 30, 2013 by Queril
Well... Here goes the hundreds of thousands of dollars Squad would of made if they put multiplayer as an add-on:sticktongue:. Nice beating them to the draw!

Now now, keep in mind that KMP would not have been possible without the groundwork laid by KLF, not to mention I'm sure there's plenty of people who would still prefer the passive-multiplayer option--no griefing!

I'm not taking donations at this time, please consider donating to your favorite pro-science/education charity instead.

Now this here is a model Human Being (or kerbal being)

So I have been trying to run this server for a while but I get stuck with this error.

I am running the server as an admin and have tried changing the Ports (http) to random 4 digit numbers. Am I doing something wrong?

So I have been trying to run this server for a while but I get stuck with this error.

I am running the server as an admin and have tried changing the Ports (http) to random 4 digit numbers. Am I doing something wrong?

try to rightclick kmpserver.exe set properties run as administrator.

try to rightclick kmpserver.exe set properties run as administrator.

I am though...
Do you have Skype open?

Do you have Skype open?

Yes...

That might be the problem

I think i got it working! Thanks!

Woah. Even with all of the problems that could/do come with it, the fact that you figured out how to do this is more than amazing.

Really, great work.
Er... Is this tested for OS X? I haven't had luck connecting to any servers. I get the hand shake and then get disconnected.

Er... Is this tested for OS X? I haven't had luck connecting to any servers. I get the hand shake and then get disconnected.

I can confirm this, over a LAN connection there is no success with macs to PCs

Strange... I've been playing over the internet on OS X, and have not been having any problems. Do you mean that connecting to a PC server in your LAN isn't working?

Ok, so... could you tell me exactly what you did?

I'm not sure what could be causing your problem... I installed KMP based exactly on what the readme said. Have you tried connecting to different servers? If the problem keeps happening, add an issue to KMP's git. It should be in the OP.

My Server:

I have a server for fun up. IP: 174.69.34.49 Port: 55905

Max Players: 4

Notes!

I have a server for fun up. It is just meant for messing with the game, not meant for actually doing science...Let's face it, doing science takes a while, but I'd like to have a career mode implemented in this. Server options anybody? If I am able to set it into career, please explain to me! I'd like to play career with my brother and friends on KSP on my server. Also the IP is here: 174.69.34.49 Port: 55905

Unfortunately I don't think Gimp has implemented career mode yet.
Fantastic! Glad someone else is taking up the task and managed to release something as well (something I wish I could've done)! Keep up the good work!

One question though - what happens if you go on a suborbital lasting say 10 minutes and sync 20 minutes into the future, what happens?

Big boom, ship go bye bye.

but really the game simulates where a craft would be relative to the time you warped forward I.E. your ship would have been destroyed 10 minutes ago

I believe it warps into the future the "on rail warp" style so it uses the current orbital elements to predict the ship position at time T. So if your ship is on a suborbital trajectory then it will most likely to be under ground, which make explosions!

Thanks to the dev, great work indeed.

If you need support (hosting web/ftp/gameserver(s)/more) let me know how i can help you.
